title: Torque and work - work from table

alttext="2.0 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad/s</mtext></math> Wheels <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> have different rotational inertias. In an experiment, each wheel is spinning on its axis with nonzero angular speed when a torque <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> is exerted on the wheel as the wheel moves through an angular displacement <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math>, causing the angular speed to change by an amount <math alttext="delta omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>ω</mi></math>. The table shows the values of <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math>, <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math>, and <math alttext="delta omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>ω</mi></math> for each wheel. Which of the following correctly relates the work <math alttext="W sub A end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="W sub B end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="W sub C end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> done on the wheel in trials <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub A is greater than W sub B, which is greater than W sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub B is greater than, open parenthesis, W sub A equals W sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub B is greater than W sub A, which is greater than W sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub C is greater than W sub B, which is greater than W sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub B is greater than, open parenthesis, W sub A equals W sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
